body_html: My guess is that the tf.gfile.FastGFile(filenames[i], "r") in the stack trace should really be tf.gfile.FastGFile(filenames[i], "rb"), because it seems to be barfing on a binary file, and Windows handles text and binary files differently.
body_text: My guess is that the tf.gfile.FastGFile(filenames[i], "r") in the stack trace should really be tf.gfile.FastGFile(filenames[i], "rb"), because it seems to be barfing on a binary file, and Windows handles text and binary files differently.
body: My guess is that the `tf.gfile.FastGFile(filenames[i], "r")` in the stack trace should really be `tf.gfile.FastGFile(filenames[i], "rb")`, because it seems to be barfing on a binary file, and Windows handles text and binary files differently.
